programme.title: Flokkens regler
programme.desc: Opplev gledesfylte fødsler, knusende dødsfall og massevis av kamper mens Waterfront Pride kjemper for å opprettholde kontrollen over bredden av Chobe-elven i Botswanas. Se disse løvene forhandle sammen kompleks familiedynamikk og maktkamp i et land med overflod. Føl på presset når flokken prøver å jakte på tilstrekkelig mat mens tørkeforholdene presser dem (og byttet deres) farlig nær døden. Se Einstein tilpasse seg et enslig liv, og se skadene etter at den nybakte moren Kalwezi kjemper for ungenes liv.

programme.title: Flokkens regler
programme.desc: Opplev gledesfylte fødsler, knusende dødsfall og massevis av kamper mens Waterfront Pride kjemper for å opprettholde kontrollen over bredden av Chobe-elven i Botswanas. Se disse løvene forhandle sammen kompleks familiedynamikk og maktkamp i et land med overflod. Kjemp mot utfordringene som kommer med regntiden, som gjør alt grønt og ødelegger løvenes kamuflasje. Se Einstein feile i å skape nye vennskap og se på fordeler og ulemper når Keeza og ungen blir kidnappet av den rivaliserende hannen Mad-Eye Moody.

programme.title: Flokkens regler
programme.desc: Opplev gledesfylte fødsler, knusende dødsfall og massevis av kamper mens Waterfront Pride kjemper for å opprettholde kontrollen over bredden av Chobe-elven i Botswanas. Se disse løvene forhandle sammen kompleks familiedynamikk og maktkamp i et land med overflod. Ønsk overflodens sesong velkommen når flomvannet trekker seg tilbake og store flokker med byttedyr returnerer til bredden av Chobe. Se Keeza og ungen unnslippe mens Caller og Tom Tom sloss med fiendene, og bryt ut i jubel når Einstein finner en make.

programme.title: Flokkens regler
programme.desc: Opplev gledesfylte fødsler, knusende dødsfall og massevis av kamper mens Waterfront Pride kjemper for å opprettholde kontrollen over bredden av Chobe-elven i Botswanas. Se disse løvene forhandle sammen kompleks familiedynamikk og maktkamp i et land med overflod. Ringen er sluttet når tørketiden kommer og Waterfront-flokken har gode jaktforhold og fornyet tro på territoriet sitt. Feir suksessen til tidligere outsider Einstein, som får tingene på stell som ny konge av sin helt egen flokk.

programme.title: Jaguardagbøker
programme.desc: Biolog Lizzie Daly samarbeider med Oncafari, et omfattende ti år langt forskningsprosjekt for jaguarer, som skal overvåke, studere og bevare verdens mest unnvikende store kattedyr: jaguaren. Føl presset når Lizzie og veterinær Joares skynder seg å sette halsbånd på flere jaguarer midt i storm, flom og strømbrudd. Prøv å finne den sky Badalo før datasamlingstaggen hans faller av, og møt en ny hunn som teamet er ivrige etter å studere.

programme.title: Jaguardagbøker
programme.desc: Biolog Lizzie Daly samarbeider med Oncafari, et omfattende ti år langt forskningsprosjekt for jaguarer, som skal overvåke, studere og bevare verdens mest unnvikende store kattedyr: jaguaren. Følg med når Onçafari-teamet blir kjent med Aroeira, den nyeste hunnen med halsbånd, og ta en kikk på Auroras unge, Apolo. Fortsett å følge Badalo, som har gått enda dypere inn i den overflommede skogen, der han setter Lizzies forskning i fare.

programme.title: Drapsmaskiner
programme.desc: La deg imponere av hvordan smarte rovdyr bruker kunnskap, smidighet og halsbrekkende hastighet for å få tak i byttet. Se lokking og hvordan noen gjemmer seg midt i glaningen, mens andre benytter seg av våpen eller kjemisk krigføring for å drepe.

programme.title: Dyrevern i byen
programme.desc: Dyrevern i byen. Sentrets kalkunkondor er klar til å slippes fri, og leter etter en flokk. Nathalie og teamet hennes prøver å skaffe finansiering til et nytt anlegg, og det medisinske teamet blir forvirret av en padde som har blitt syk på mystisk vis.

programme.title: Orangutangskolen
programme.desc: Visste du at det finnes en orangutang som er albino? Det er bare rapportert om en eneste i hele verden, og den kommer til Orangutangskolen. Tenåringsmoren Clara og babyen hennes Clarita skal få dra tilbake til øyen de kom fra. Livet til ni måneder gamle Alejandra blir helt forandret etter en fryktelig ulykke i barnehagen. På skogsskolen nyter elevene undervisning ved bassenget, og Valentino beviser at han er mye mer enn bare klassens klovn.

programme.title: Australias skjulte øyer
programme.desc: Australias skjulte øyer. Lady Elliot Island er selve kronjuvelen i Great Barrier Reef, den største levende strukturen i verden. På denne sørligste øya på revet finner vi svimlende virvler av farger, liv og mangfold både over og under vann.

programme.title: Australias skjulte øyer
programme.desc: Australias skjulte øyer. Kangaroo Island på sørkysten av Australia er en festning i havgapet omgitt av frådende hav og brutale ishavsvinder. Den er et fortryllende tilfluktssted der noen av de mest kjente dyrene fra fastlandet klamrer seg fast.

programme.title: Australias skjulte øyer
programme.desc: Australias skjulte øyer. Christmas Island ligger over tusen kilometer nordvest for Australia, og er en bitteliten øy som stikker opp av Indiahavet og huser planter og dyr som ikke finnes noe annet sted i verden. Fuglene regjerer i luften, og det fantastiske landskapet danner bakteppe for et mirakuløst trekk som omfatter millioner av fugler og dyr.

programme.title: Australias skjulte øyer
programme.desc: Australias skjulte øyer. Like sør for Great Barrier Reef og Steinbukkens vendekrets ligger Fraser Island som en utstrakt firfisle. Øya er 120 kilometer lang og opptil 25 kilometer bred, og er nå den største sandøya i verden. På en eller annen måte har livet blomstret på denne næringsfattige sandbanken. Dingoer patruljerer skogene på leting etter kenguruunger, og hvitbukhavørner gjennomsøker strendene fra oven. Fra innsjøene til skogene og de krystallklare elvene – Fraser Island er en unik sammensetning av utrolige habitater som har gitt øya verdensarvstatus.

programme.title: Irlands ville øyer med Eoin Warner
programme.desc: Mange eksperter anser Irlands folketomme øyer som noen av naturens siste festninger. Vi får vite mer om øyenes naturhistorie, miljøutfordringer og tradisjonelle folklore. Eoin Warner fortsetter reisen sørover fra County Mayo til County Clare. Underveis får han se de utrolige kampene mellom gråseler med barn på Inishkeaøyene.

programme.title: Irlands ville øyer med Eoin Warner
programme.desc: Mange eksperter anser Irlands folketomme øyer som noen av naturens siste festninger. Vi får vite mer om øyenes naturhistorie, miljøutfordringer og tradisjonelle folklore. Se hvordan rødnebbterner klarer å pendle over 80 000 kilometer i året for å tilbringe sommeren på Mahareeøyene i Kerry. Dra på hvalsafari utenfor Brandon Head, og se Irlands største dyreskue: en koloni med 1000 gråseler på Great Blasket Island.

programme.title: Afrikas kyst
programme.desc: Afrikas kyst. Dette er historien om den "gylne skogen

programme.title: Afrikas kyst
programme.desc: Afrikas kyst. Bestanden av kappingviner i det sørlige Afrika minker, men den karismatiske arten har funnet et tilfluktssted på to øyer i Algoabukten. Dette er historien om pingvinenes daglige kamp for å oppfostre familier i et ugjestmildt miljø.

programme.title: Historier fra Zambia
programme.desc: Historier fra Zambia. I dette lille skogsområdet går to unge aper gjennom den vanskeligste tiden i livet. Mens de prøver å finne sin plass i verden, må de også lære hvilke naboer som er venner og hvilke som er fiender. Hvem skal de stole på, og hvem skal de unngå? De opplever tap og får venner, og oppdager hva det betyr å være en del av Skogflokken.

programme.title: Historier fra Zambia
programme.desc: Historier fra Zambia. Villmarken i Zambia er et hardt sted å leve. Her må mange dyr gå sammen i grupper for å hjelpe til med å forsvare territoriet, beskytte ungene, finne mat og unnslippe rovdyr.

programme.title: Historier fra Zambia
programme.desc: Historier fra Zambia. Hver eneste dag blir det oppdaget et kadaver i Luangwadalen. Alle forteller historien om hvordan de døde. I CSI: Safari undersøker vi hva som tok livet av tre kadavre som er funnet ...

programme.title: Airborne
programme.desc: Få et ekte fugleperspektiv av verden med naturens mest vågale piloter. Tross tyngdekraften med dyreverdenens mest dristige flygere. Få et ekte fugleperspektiv på verden og opplev friheten og gleden ved å fly mens ville skapninger lærer å lette, ta en matbit i luften, finne en make og gå fremtiden i møte sammen.

programme.title: Airborne
programme.desc: Få et ekte fugleperspektiv av verden med naturens mest vågale piloter. Dra på jakt med flygere som er eksperter på å fange bytter i luften. Se metamorfosen til den akrobatiske keiserøyenstikkeren, beundre tårnuglas snikende jaktmetoder og se en salamanders vågale hopp ned i avgrunnen.

programme.title: Airborne
programme.desc: Få et ekte fugleperspektiv av verden med naturens mest vågale piloter. Ta en titt på dyr som er vinnerne av luftens parringskonkurranse. Fly sammen med en bie som lager sin egen kjærlighetsdrikk, se en flygeagam sveve for å bekjempe rivaler, og vær vitne til en grasiøs paso doble som matcher japanske traner for livet.

programme.title: Airborne
programme.desc: Få et ekte fugleperspektiv av verden med naturens mest vågale piloter. Bli med på et eventyr når dyr drar på bemerkelsesverdige reiser. Naviger gjennom en trelabyrint med en rask hønsehauk, bli med på en sandsvales vandring til et fjerntliggende vannhull, og se en mumlende flokk stær som trollbinder fiendene sine.

programme.title: Jordens utvikling
programme.desc: Jordens utvikling. Dra til planetens hurtig smeltende poler, hvor dyr gir forskerne tips om vår fremtidige eksistens. Lær hvordan bevegelsene til isbjørner, pingviner og andre arktiske skapninger kan hjelpe mennesker å kartlegge (og unngå) global oppvarming.

programme.title: Jordens utvikling
programme.desc: Jordens utvikling. Utforsk et av verdens mest vitale, men oversette, habitater, og lær hvordan gressletter kan forsinke klimaendringer ved å trekke til seg mer karbon enn skogene. Møt vitale arter, som bison og puma, som kan gjenopprette denne ressursen og helbrede planeten vår.

programme.title: After the wildfires
programme.desc: Vi følger den enorme arbeidet som blir gjort for å gjenopprette skadene buskbrannene som herjet Australia i 2020, gjorde på villmarkslivet.

programme.title: Airborne
programme.desc: Få et ekte fugleperspektiv av verden med naturens mest vågale piloter. Tross tyngdekraften med dyreverdenens mest dristige flygere. programme.title: Jordens utvikling
programme.desc: Jordens utvikling. Utforsk et av verdens mest vitale, men oversette, habitater, og lær hvordan gressletter kan forsinke klimaendringer ved å trekke til seg mer karbon enn skogene. Møt vitale arter, som bison og puma, som kan gjenopprette denne ressursen og helbrede planeten vår.

programme.title: After the wildfires
programme.desc: Vi følger den enorme arbeidet som blir gjort for å gjenopprette skadene buskbrannene som herjet Australia i 2020, gjorde på villmarkslivet.

programme.title: Evolusjonens mysterier
programme.desc: Evolusjonens mysterier. Har du noen gang lurt på hvorfor mandrillene har så fargerike fjes, hvorfor gribbene er skallet, eller hvorfor hammerhaiene har hammerformede hoder? Se hvordan dyrene har klart å overleve ved å utvikle seg fra halsen og opp.

programme.title: Snøleoparder med Dan ONeill
programme.desc: Reis gjennom hjertet av Sentral-Asia med biolog og naturforsker Dan O’Neill i et kappløp mot tiden på jakt etter den gåtefulle snøleoparden. Opplev den rå, ufiltrerte oppførselen til disse majestetiske skapningene som aldri tidligere har blitt vist.

programme.title: Snøleoparder med Dan ONeill
programme.desc: Reis gjennom hjertet av Sentral-Asia med biolog og naturforsker Dan O’Neill i et kappløp mot tiden på jakt etter den gåtefulle snøleoparden. Opplev den rå, ufiltrerte oppførselen til disse majestetiske skapningene som aldri tidligere har blitt vist. Snus deg rundt The Dudes territorie med Dan og teamet hans, som mistenker at hunner kan spille en større rolle enn først antatt. Still tidligere forskning om snølepoarders oppførsel til veggs når Dan snubler over en uvanlig gruppe store kattedyr.

programme.title: Flokkens regler
programme.desc: Opplev gledesfylte fødsler, knusende dødsfall og massevis av kamper mens Waterfront Pride kjemper for å opprettholde kontrollen over bredden av Chobe-elven i Botswanas. Se disse løvene forhandle sammen kompleks familiedynamikk og maktkamp i et land med overflod. Ønsk overflodens sesong velkommen når flomvannet trekker seg tilbake og store flokker med byttedyr returnerer til bredden av Chobe. Se Keeza og ungen unnslippe mens Caller og Tom Tom sloss med fiendene, og bryt ut i jubel når Einstein finner en make.

programme.title: Født i stormen
programme.desc: Iskald og frodande tuktar Nord-Atlanteren kystane rundt seg. Ei ugjestmild verd der berre dyr frå dei sterkaste ættene overlever. Vinteren slepp snart taket. På Island flørtar fjellreven, mens norske reinsdyr førebur seg på kalving. Men uver truar. Britisk naturserie. Vinteren slipper jerngrepet. På Island skynder fjellrevene seg over fjellene for å parre seg. I Shetland oppdrar en oter ungene sine. I Norge trekker reinsdyrene nedover til kalvingsområdene. En stor mars-storm treffer de stormfødtes landområder.

programme.title: Født i stormen
programme.desc: Iskald og frodande tuktar Nord-Atlanteren kystane rundt seg. Ei ugjestmild verd der berre dyr frå dei sterkaste ættene overlever. Vinteren slepp snart taket. På Island flørtar fjellreven, mens norske reinsdyr førebur seg på kalving. Men uver truar. Britisk naturserie. Opplev Nord-Atlanterens intense, korte sommer med dyrelivet der. Følg fjellrevens unger som lærer å jakte for å overleve, en oterunge som drar ut alene for første gang, en lundefugl som søker en make og et lite reinsdyr som tar sine første steg.

programme.title: Primatenes rike
programme.desc: Primatenes rike. Bavianen er en av verdens mest vellykkede og dominante primater, og finnes over hele Afrika. Vi ser nærmere på hvordan disse fascinerende dyrene har tilpasset seg livet i fjell, ørkener, langs bredden av sure innsjøer og til og med rett ved storhavet.

programme.title: Historier fra Zambia
programme.desc: Historier fra Zambia. I Zambia finner vi tre svært spesielle og ulike afrikanske paradis: den lavtliggende, hete Luangwadalen, den høytliggende, tørre Liuwasletten og den kjølige, våte Kasanka nasjonalpark. Alle stedene defineres av jorden de ligger på og formes av årstidene, og tilbyr noe unikt til dyrene som velger å slå seg ned her.

programme.title: Snøleoparder med Dan ONeill
programme.desc: Reis gjennom hjertet av Sentral-Asia med biolog og naturforsker Dan O’Neill i et kappløp mot tiden på jakt etter den gåtefulle snøleoparden. Opplev den rå, ufiltrerte oppførselen til disse majestetiske skapningene som aldri tidligere har blitt vist.

programme.title: Orchestre de la Suisse Romande, Martin Frost, Jonathan Nott: Mozart, Bruckner
programme.desc: Orchestre de la Suisse Romande, Jonathan Nott (direction)Martin Frost (clarinette)Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart 1756 - 1791Concerto for Clarinet and Orchestra in A major KV 622Anton Bruckner 1824 - 1897Symphony No. 2 in C minor (1877 version)Geneva, Victoria Hall, 13 March 2024.

programme.title: Dubai Opera
programme.sub-title: Behzod Abduraimov, Tokyo Philharmonic, Marios Papadopoulos - Shor, Beethoven
programme.desc: Alexey Shor 1970 - Piano Concerto No. 1. Ludwig van Beethoven 1770 – 1827 Symphony No. 7 in A major, Op.92. Dubai, Opera, 15 April 2025 (InClassica International Music Festival 2025).

programme.title: InterMezzo
programme.desc: Espacio que incluye la emision de una seleccion de los mejores momentos musicales. Una manera diferente y muy variada de descubrir la música, los interpretes y las orquestas.

programme.title: Strauss: Arabella - Teatro Real de Madrid
programme.desc: Arabella ‘Lyrische Komodie’ in three acts Richard Strauss (1864-1949)Libretto by Hugo von HofmannsthalFirst performance at Dresden, Sachsisches Staatstheater, 1 July 1933.

programme.title: Judith Jáuregui, Quatuor Gerhard - Dvořák, Granados
programme.desc: Judith Jáuregui (piano), Quatuor Gerhard Antonín Dvořák (1841-1904) Piano Quintet no. 2 in A major op. 81Enrique Granados (1867-1916)Piano Quintet in G minor op. 49Lille Piano Festival, 12 June 2022.

programme.title: Rafael Riqueni, Nerja - Chaillot - Theâtre national de la Danse
programme.desc: Rafael Riqueni has been developing original compositions for twenty years, halfway between contemporary Andalusian music, the classical repertoire of Manuel de Falla and Turina or Granados, and flamenco inspiration. He chose as his theme the story of the fortuitous discovery in 1959, in the south of Andalusia, of an exceptional group of prehistoric caves decorated by a group of young people.

programme.title: Charles Lloyd Sky Quartet Ljubljana 2024
programme.desc: Charles Lloyd Sky Quartet. Directed by Amos Rozenberg Ljubljana Jazz Festival, 10 July 2024.

programme.title: InterMezzo
programme.desc: Espacio que incluye la emision de una seleccion de los mejores momentos musicales. Una manera diferente y muy variada de descubrir la música, los interpretes y las orquestas.

programme.desc: L’Heure espagnole ‘Comedie musicale’ in one act and 21 scenes by Maurice Ravel 1875 - 1937. Premiered in Paris, Opera Comique, 19 May 1911. programme.title: Madeleine Peyroux at Bordeauxs Grand-Theâtre
programme.desc: Born in the United States, Madeleine Peyroux is a jazz singer and guitarist with an unclassifiable style and an exceptional artistic personality, carried by a voice that is both soft and husky, with blues and folk accents. After spending part of her childhood in the United States, she moved to France as a teenager where she joined her first jazz bands. An atypical artist, she performs a lot in the street while participating in festivals and creating her own albums. In 2004, she had an international success with Careless Love. Other albums have been released since, including the recent Anthem (2018), the title of which is taken from a Leonard Cohen song.

programme.title: Pierre Boulez and the Lucerne Festival Academy
programme.desc: For over six decades, Pierre Boulez had a greater influence on the development of contemporary music than anyone else. Already in his younger days, he gained a reputation as a doughty champion of the avant-garde. With his compositions, interpretations and ideas, he indelibly shaped the international music scene – not only as a composer and conductor, but also as a music philosopher and teacher.

programme.title: The life I love - The pianist Menahem Pressler
programme.desc: The music world has known Menahem Pressler for more than half a century and mainly for his work with the famous Beaux Arts Trio. He was the heart of this ensemble and when in 2008 the trio decided to separate, it was not the end for Menahem Pressler’s career – in fact it was the start of a most remarkable and successful path as a soloist and in 2013, the 90-year-old grand seigneur of the piano gave his long overdue debut with the Berliner Philharmoniker. In ‘The life I love – the pianist Menahem Pressler’, from talks with Pressler over excerpts from one of his Master Classes, to interviews with artists like Daniel Harding, Quatuor Ébène, Leonidas Kavakos or Daniel Hope, we will gain deep insights into the life of this enchantingly “venerable prodigy”. Menahem Pressler died on May 6, 2023Subtitles available for this program with your remote control.

programme.title: MTV Unplugged
programme.desc: A staple of MTVs programming lineup in the 1990s, `Unplugged features popular artists performing acoustic -- or unplugged -- versions of some of their biggest hits, offering their fans a chance to experience favourite tunes in a new way. Name recognition isnt in short supply on the show as many of the eras biggest musical acts made their way through the `Unplugged studio over the years, with a roster that includes Paul McCartney, Mariah Carey, Eric Clapton, Bruce Springsteen and Nirvana. A number of the performances were subsequently released as live albums, in some cases earning Grammy Awards for the artists. Check out legendary Canadian singer-songwriter Bryan Adams playing some of his biggest hits stripped back exclusively for MTV Unplugged. Filmed at New Yorks Hammerstein Ballroom in September 1997.

programme.title: a-ha - Unplugged: Summer Solstice
programme.desc: The first a-ha MTV Unplugged Concert ever. The album “MTV Unplugged – Summer Solstice” is being released including a very special LIVE experience.Share the impressive unplugged concert with a-ha in front of astonishing scenery on the picturesque island of Giske, located on the Norwegian coastline.Experience the concert including some hit singles like “Take On Me”, “The Sun Always Shines On TV”, and “The Living Daylights” as well as two new Songs. On 5th March 1991, Sting recorded an intimate live set for MTV Unplugged, featuring songs by The Police and from one of his many hit solo albums, "The Soul Cages".

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: Rob Dyrdek visar videoklipp från internet tillsammans med kandisgaster och programledarkollegorna Sterling "Steelo" Brim. programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: Rob Dyrdek visar videoklipp från internet tillsammans med kandisgaster och programledarkollegorna Sterling "Steelo" Brim. programme.desc: Rob Dyrdek visar videoklipp från internet tillsammans med kandisgaster och programledarkollegorna Sterling "Steelo" Brim. programme.title: Ink Master
programme.desc: USA:s framsta tatuerare går ut i strid. 18 ansedda tatuerarfirmor skickar ut sina basta anstallda i jakten på titeln Master Shop. Ingen går saker nar teamen måste gora om canvasdukarna till krigare i elimineringen. Kampen om 100 000 dollar och titeln Ink Master fortsatter.

programme.title: Ink Master
programme.desc: USA:s framsta tatuerare går ut i strid. 18 ansedda tatuerarfirmor skickar ut sina basta anstallda i jakten på titeln Master Shop. Team Nunez gnistrar till i en elektrifierande blixtutmaning. Konsalliansen ger tjejerna blodsmak. Kampen om prispengarna och titeln intensifieras.

programme.title: M is for Music
programme.desc: Hang med på en titt på de hetaste hitsen just nu. Har finns underbar musik for alla smaker. Njut av det.

programme.title: Sketchbook
programme.desc: An intimate instructional documentary series, Sketchbook takes us onto the desks and into the lives of talented artists and animators. Each episode focuses on a single artist teaching us how to draw a single iconic character from a Walt Disney Animation Studios film. As we learn the steps to drawing these characters, we also discover that the artists themselves each have a unique story to tell about how they made their way to Disney and their chosen character. From the creators of Chefs Table, this exclusive experience will give viewers of all ages a new understanding of how these beloved characters come to life on screen while introducing them to a new cast of real-life characters along way. Raphael Federici (street artist), Marine Goodmorning (illustrator), Luca Fiore (cartoonist) and Harry Boudchicha (drawing teacher) reveal their best drawing techniques. Each episode focuses on a specific subject:movement, oil painting, shadows, hair... For the first 10 minutes, each artist gives a theoretical lesson illustrated by sketches. Then they each start working on their creation. Finally, they end with a debrief, comparingand explaining their techniques.

programme.title: Exhibition on Screen
programme.sub-title: Rembrandt at the National Gallery, London and Rijksmuseum, Amsterdam
programme.desc: Up close with the world’s most celebrated artists and artworks in the highly acclaimed Exhibition on Screen film series. Every Rembrandt exhibition is eagerly awaited, but this exhibition organized by Londons National Gallery and Amsterdams Rijksmuseum was an unprecedented event. The documentary highlights the historic Rembrandt exhibition, while tracing his life. Rembrandt is one of the greatest artists who ever lived, and this deeply moving documentary seeks to explore the truth about the man behind the legend.

programme.title: Photo Contest
programme.desc: In each episode of Photo Contest, two contestants compete on an imposed theme such as rockn roll, Japan or architecture. They have one hour to take the best possible photographs before editing them for 30 minutes in a studio. The photographs they have selected are then presented to Agnès Gregoire, editor-in-chief of PHOTO magazine, who will have to choose the best photographer.

programme.title: Artists Workshop
programme.desc: In the Artists workshop series, we offer you a privileged meeting with an artist, or the discovery of an artist or an important place for the history of art. Whether they are painters, visual artists, sculptors... These people all have the same passion for art and this show is an opportunity to enter their different universes, to discover what drives them, inspires them and maybe that will give rise to vocations. In the Artists workshop series, we offer you a privileged meeting with an artist, or the discovery of an artist or an important place for the history of art. Whether they are painters, visual artists, sculptors... These people all have the same passion for art and this series is an opportunity to enter their different universes, to discover what drives them, inspires them and maybe that will give rise to vocations.

programme.title: An hour with
programme.desc: Classical, Modern, Contemporary Art… From ancient to contemporary art, discover the masterpieces and the artists of today. Take an hour break to discover the work of a French painter, Georges Seurat. You will discover his labour with « Ile de France » landscape, Study for « a Sunday afternoon at the grande jatte », Study for « La grande jatte ».

programme.title: An hour with
programme.desc: Classical, Modern, Contemporary Art… From ancient to contemporary art, discover the masterpieces and the artists of today. Take an hour break to discover the work of a French painter, Jean-François Millet. You will discover his labour with Naked woman sleeping, Two bathers or The church at greville.

programme.title: Video Art
programme.desc: Street art, performances, digital art... Because the new forms of Art and their invigorating character, even iconoclastic, have been able to attract a new public until now refractory to go inside the interior of our beautiful museums.

programme.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Antiques experts accompany celebrities on a road trip around the UK searching for treasures and competing to make the most money at auction. Comedy legend Jennifer Saunders and best pal, top actress Patricia Potter take to the road on a humdinger of a trip. Joined by veteran antiquers Phillip Serrell and Mark Stacey they shop in Berkshire, Hampshire and Oxfordshire before heading for an auction in Greenwich, London. Jennifer and Phil detour to hear about Fred Karno, the man credited with inventing slapstick comedy. While Patricia and Mark learn how a surgeon from Reading used his incredible sense of smell to successfully treat soldiers injured in World War One.And, Phil gets custard pied – what’s not to love?

programme.title: Within the frame
programme.desc: Discover or re-discover the masterpieces of the greatest painters of history through our documentary series Within The Frame. From impressionists to surrealists, from Leonard Da Vinci to Paul Cezanne, every episode will immerge you into a virtual tour of a paintings collection. You will see the most impressive paintings ever made and wont miss a single detail.

programme.title: Little Sketches
programme.desc: In 64 fun episodes, Gia-Haï Phan teaches you all the sketching techniques you need.

programme.title: The Chateaux of France, Living Splendors
programme.desc: This series takes us into the world of historical personalities and brings us face to face with those who keep the castles alive. The Azay-le-Rideau Castle is nestled at the core of the old city and surrounded by a romantic park, the castle seems to be built on water. This intimate, almost hidden edifice is endowed with an ageless charm and a powerful bond with history. Today, it is renowned as one of the most representative works of the period, revealing a whole new conception of architecture and life. It was indeed a place meant to house knowledgeable ladies of the time. Today, this Renaissance treasure counts more than 300 000 visitors a year and represents a considerable economic asset for the city. It is also the combination of expertise, skills, character and devotion of its caretakers which animates this splendid castle with a historic soul.

programme.title: Private Tour
programme.desc: For everyone who haven’t a chance to go to the museum, "Private Tour" propose you a private tour in 13 minutes to the best exposition of the moment with a professionnal or an expository commissioner. Private visit takes you to discover the exhibition « The Drawing Factory », an exposition of 33 contemporary artists in Paris, from March to September 2021. This exposition was initiated by Christine Phal, founder of Drawing Lab. It brought together 33 different cotemporary drawing artists that come from everywhere and who were selected. These artists have taken over an old hotel in order to pursue their projects or develop new ones. During this visit you’ll discover the singular universe of artists expressing their art in this ephemeral workshop, exposing abstract or surrealist works.

programme.title: Exhibition on Screen
programme.sub-title: Matisse From Moma and Tate Modern
programme.desc: Up close with the world’s most celebrated artists and artworks in the highly acclaimed Exhibition on Screen film series. Discover the work of Matisse through the exhibitions at Tate Modern in London and MoMA in New York (2014) and enjoy the original performance of Royal Ballet star dancer Zenaida Yanowsky, who interprets the colors and dynamism of Matisses painting to the jazz music of Courtney Pine. Punctuated by interviews with experts and rare archival footage of Matisse at work, this documentary will provide a special insight into the last chapter of the painters career.

programme.title: Origami
programme.desc: A square piece of paper and some patience, this is all you need to transform a flat surface into a superb tridimensional piece of art! Origami is about the art of paper folding, a Japanese and Chinese millenary tradition. In modern usage, the word “origami” is used as an inclusive term for all paper folding, regardless of their cultural origin. Different folding and sculpting techniques, new models, bright colors – you’ll see all of this in our program! We will teach you how to transform a flat square sheet of paper into a finished sculpture – from simple to complex!

programme.title: Little Sketches
programme.desc: In 64 fun episodes, Gia-Haï Phan teaches you all the sketching techniques you need.

programme.title: A night in Orsay with Charles Berling
programme.desc: The Musee d’Orsay not only houses the largest collection of impressionist and post-impressionist masterpieces in the world, but the building itself is impressive. What about visiting it alone at night with a theatrical guide?

programme.title: The Grand Palais Metamorphosis
programme.desc: The Grand Palais is currently undergoing the most extensive renovation in its history. The film, directed by Stefan Cornic, tells the story of the current and past renovation projects.

programme.title: The Chateaux of France, Living Splendors
programme.desc: This series takes us into the world of historical personalities and brings us face to face with those who keep the castles alive. Chaumont-sur-Loire is not only known for its exceptional location at the heart of the Loire Valley, but especially for its monumental castle, listed at the UNESCO World Heritage. Under the hands of Renaissance artists, the former fortress was turned into an ornamented edifice and became famous for its aristocratic parties. Today, it remains a major touristic attraction, with about 400 000 visitors strolling the aisles of its International Garden Festival, or enjoying the cultural programs offered at the castle: contemporary works, concerts, photographers... The domain is a new place of convergence for the artistic life, merging past and present with the same avant-garde and refinement essence.

programme.title: Private Tour
programme.desc: For everyone who haven’t a chance to go to the museum, "Private Tour" propose you a private tour in 13 minutes to the best exposition of the moment with a professionnal or an expository commissioner. Private visit takes you to discover the exhibition "Kasimir Zgorecki, photographing "Little Poland" 1924-1939" at the Louvre Museum in Lens. In the middle of the 20th century, Kasimir Zgorecki worked in the mining basin of northern France. This exhibition takes place in a particular context because it is the centenary of the signing of an agreement between France and Poland on emigration and immigration, which led to the massive arrival of Polish workers in France to work in the mines. This is the case of the photographer Kasimir Zgorecki.

programme.title: Graffiti World
programme.desc: Graffiti World is a short program dedicated to contemporary urban art around the world. Each episode explores a specific city, highlighting iconic works of street art. Graffiti World is a short program dedicated to contemporary urban art around the world. Each episode explores a specific city, highlighting iconic works of street art. Local soundscape accompanies the images for an authentic, commentary-free immersion. The program showcases the creativity and diversity of artistic expression in public spaces. An invitation to discover the richness of graffiti as an art form in its own right.

programme.title: The decisive moment
programme.desc: In each episode of the decisive moment, we welcome a photographer whom we have asked to select three photos that have marked their life and their career. Whether they are reporters, portraitists or fashion photographers, they all have the same passion and will share it with us. In this episode, we will discuss with Spencer Tunick, an American visual photographer. He is known for his photographic compositions featuring hundreds of volunteers, men and women, posing nude, mostly in urban settings. He does not define himself as a photographer, but as a creator of installations, the photos being only the representation of his works.

programme.title: The decisive moment
programme.desc: In each episode of the decisive moment, we welcome a photographer whom we have asked to select three photos that have marked their life and their career. Whether they are reporters, portraitists or fashion photographers, they all have the same passion and will share it with us. In this episode, we will meet Pierre Morel, a photojournalist. He started this job very young and considers it a way of commitment and activism. What interests him is to have the point of view of several photographers on the society and he tries to give his own point of view in his turn.

programme.title: Architectures
programme.desc: Initiated by Richard Copans and Stan Neumann in 1994, the Architectures collection is comprised of 67 episodes, each focusing on a single building from classical, modern, or contemporary architecture. These "architecture masterclasses" are a magnificent mixture of rigor, pleasure and intelligence. Dominique Perrault, creator of the BNF and the Olympic Velodrome in Berlin, takes up a concept that is dear to him: the disappearance of architecture. The urban dimension and territorial organization take precedence over the built object. Landscape takes precedence over architecture.

programme.title: Art investigation
programme.desc: Art Investigation is a documentary series, each episode is devoted to a particular work. Created in the 1780s by the prestigious Sèvres factory, the Breast Bowl is an unusual piece of porcelain that has intrigued and fascinated for over two centuries. Commissioned by King Louis XVI for Marie-Antoinette, this teton-bowl is said to have been moulded on the queens breast... A legend that contributes to the magic of this iconic piece. It disappeared during the French Revolution and only reappeared at Sèvres in 1970. Until today, we will also see that this piece inspires designers. Over the centuries, they have vied with each other in imagination and talent to give their own version of the famous teacup.

programme.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Antiques experts accompany celebrities on a road trip around the UK searching for treasures and competing to make the most money at auction. Two luvvies from the world of stage and TV, Ruth Madoc and Su Pollard, best known for their appearances in sitcom Hi-De-Hi, are antique hunting with Phil Serrell and Raj Bisram. Setting off from the Welsh border town of Monmouth they head for auction in Congleton, Cheshire. Ruth also gets to find out about the incredible 19th century nurse – and it’s not Florence Nightingale – whilst Su visits ancient Roman town Caerleon and finds time for an amphitheatre showdown with Phil. And Su attempts to resolve an age old mystery...does Phil wear a wig?

programme.title: Within the frame
programme.desc: Discover or re-discover the masterpieces of the greatest painters of history through our documentary series Within The Frame. From impressionists to surrealists, from Leonard Da Vinci to Paul Cezanne, every episode will immerge you into a virtual tour of a paintings collection. You will see the most impressive paintings ever made and wont miss a single detail.

programme.title: Draw me what you see
programme.desc: The talented illustrator Fred Benaglia shares his vision of drawing and gives us practical advice, for young and old drawers! The talented illustrator Fred Benaglia shares his vision of drawing and gives us practical advice, for young and old drawers! A pencil and a sheet of paper, you dont need much material to make a drawing you can be proud of! To achieve this, you will be guided by Fred Benaglia, creator of Adelidelo, the mischievous little heroine of Pomme dApi. Fabulous beings or objects will appear in no time: a horse, a car, a dragon, a tree, a dog, a princess, a cat, a flower, a witch, a magician...

programme.title: Art Quiz
programme.desc: Test your knowledge and your memory in fine arts, architecture, photography, street art and a dozen other topics with our Art Quiz popups !

programme.title: A special day
programme.desc: Museum takes you behind the scenes of prestigious institutions and lets you experience a special day by immersing yourself in the daily life of an art world professional. In this episode, we will spend a special day with Charlotte Le Percin, cultural mediator at the Cernuschi Museum in Paris. She is the intermediary between the works and the visitors. Her audience ranges from kindergarteners to pensioners. With her, we will discover the life of a guide in a museum.

programme.title: Graffiti World
programme.desc: Graffiti World is a short program dedicated to contemporary urban art around the world. Each episode explores a specific city, highlighting iconic works of street art. Graffiti World is a short program dedicated to contemporary urban art around the world. Each episode explores a specific city, highlighting iconic works of street art. Local soundscape accompanies the images for an authentic, commentary-free immersion. The program showcases the creativity and diversity of artistic expression in public spaces. An invitation to discover the richness of graffiti as an art form in its own right.

programme.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
programme.sub-title: Tanni Grey Thompson and Jade Jones
programme.desc: Antiques experts accompany celebrities on a road trip around the UK searching for treasures and competing to make the most money at auction. Today we’re in the North East of England with top wheelchair paralympians Tanni Grey-Thompson and Jade Jones. Tanni has a record haul of medals and records, while her promising young protege Jade is just starting out on her athletics career. In the company of experts Phil Serrell and David Harper, the Baroness from County Durham and Middlesbrough’s Jade will be on the lookout for antiques to take to auction in Harrogate. Tanni also tries her hand at traditional glass making and Jade learns about the man who was a design champion of the region.

programme.title: China - Masters of the Arts
programme.desc: The series “China - Masters of the Arts” explores millennia-old Chinese art. Five masters reveal their aesthetics, rooted in ancient traditions and Asian philosophy blending Taoism, Confucianism, and Buddhism. On enamel fired at extreme heat, the master paints China’s legendary heroes, from Mulan to Ba Wang Bie Ji, showcasing imperial dynasties across the centuries.

programme.title: Travelers
programme.desc: Travelers is the "city guide" for art lovers ... But not only that. Exhibitions, museums, galleries, artists but also hotels, restaurants, bars and shops ... In short, everything you need to prepare for your next weekend is in Travelers. Today, Travelers takes you to Marseille in France, the city of sun, petanque, pastis and the Olympique de Marseille soccer team. We will start the visit on the Old Port, then we will go to the street of the canebière which is a very famous street of the city. We will visit the Museum of Civilization and the Mediterranean, the Le Corbusier hotel and especially the Notre-Dame de la Garde basilica. Marseille has a lot more to offer us.

programme.title: Art Quiz
programme.desc: Test your knowledge and your memory in fine arts, architecture, photography, street art and a dozen other topics with our Art Quiz popups !

programme.title: The Chateaux of France, Living Splendors
programme.desc: This series takes us into the world of historical personalities and brings us face to face with those who keep the castles alive. The royal fortress is a symbolic place of European history and has been the theatre of diplomacy and strategy for decades, namely with the Plantagenets or Joan of Arc. Today, it is renowned for its cellars and underground tunnels which houses the famous Rabelais vintage. After a colossal enterprise of renovation, the caste reopened and invites us into the royal apartments. The spectacular display offers a renewed and interactive presentation with various films depicting key historical times in Chinon, but also augmented reality and connected devices to immerse the visitors into the secrets of the fortress.

programme.title: Art investigation
programme.desc: Art Investigation is a documentary series, each episode is devoted to a particular work. It is an equestrian set of Francis The 1st composed of a riders armour, a horses bard, and a saddle and stirrups. This diplomatic gift ordered in the 16th century and intended for François The 1st never reached its recipient. Three centuries later, it was Napoleon I who had it brought to France in 1806. It was taken as a war treasure to Germany during the Third Reich and only returned to France in 1956. Since then, it has been kept in the Musee de lArmee at the Hôtel des Invalides.

programme.desc: Art Investigation is a documentary series, each episode is devoted to a particular work. Emile Zola and Paul Cezanne met on the school benches in Aix en Provence. From their "brotherhood of genius

Located on Trafalgar square in London, the National Gallery is home to one of the world’s largest collection of Western art. It boasts over 2,000 paintings, spanning from the Middle Ages to the early twentieth century. Admire the greatest masterpieces of this unique museum from the most remarkable Flemish painters (Van Eyck, Vermeer), French impressionists (Monet, Cezanne) and, last but certainly not least, English masters such as Hogarth and Turner.Enjoy your visit!

programme.title: Exhibition on Screen
programme.desc: Up close with the world’s most celebrated artists and artworks in the highly acclaimed Exhibition on Screen film series. After a two-year touring exhibition, in 2015 Girl with a Pearl Earring returned to the Mauritshuis Museum in The Hague. At 350 years old, the eternal Girl has always retained her aura of mystery and charm. The proof is in the number of curious onlookers (1.2 million) who flocked to catch a glimpse of her during her stay in Japan. The documentary seeks to uncover the many enigmas surrounding this extraordinary painting and its mysterious creator - Vermeer. Who was this girl? Why and how did Vermeer paint this picture? Come and travel back in time to discover Johannes Vermeer, visit the charming museum in The Hague and answer all these questions.

Take an hour break to discover the work of a French painter, Theodore Gericault. You will discover his labour with An Officer of the Imperial horse guards, Heroic landscape with fisherman or The Horse race.

programme.title: An hour with
programme.desc: Classical, Modern, Contemporary Art… From ancient to contemporary art, discover the masterpieces and the artists of today. Take an hour break to discover the work of an Italian painter, Amedeo Modigliani. You will discover his labour with Caryatid, Lolotte or others portraits.

programme.title: Video Art
programme.desc: Street art, performances, digital art... Because the new forms of Art and their invigorating character, even iconoclastic, have been able to attract a new public until now refractory to go inside the interior of our beautiful museums.

programme.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Antiques experts accompany celebrities on a road trip around the UK searching for treasures and competing to make the most money at auction. Legends of stage and screen, Charles Dance and Geraldine James join antiques experts Natasha Raskin and Will Axon on this Road Trip romp around Wiltshire. Charles finds a pair of Edwardian silver vases he hopes will prove profitable at an auction in Essex. Geraldine, however, bumps into a chap in the street with a 19th Century French Empire secretaire. It costs her a small fortune – will the gamble pay off? A diversion from the shops sees Charles end up in the cockpit of a very old helicopter while Geraldine learns how a small part of Swindon dating back 170 years influenced the creation of the modern NHS.

programme.title: Within the frame
programme.desc: Discover or re-discover the masterpieces of the greatest painters of history through our documentary series Within The Frame. From impressionists to surrealists, from Leonard Da Vinci to Paul Cezanne, every episode will immerge you into a virtual tour of a paintings collection. You will see the most impressive paintings ever made and wont miss a single detail. Paul Serusier spent his entire summer of 1888 painting with Paul Gauguin in Pont-Aven, Brittany. This master of colour gave invaluable advice to the young Serusier, who was part of the new generation of painters known as the Post-Impressionists. The Impressionists favoured the visual sensation of the motif, but they had not broken with the illusionist rendering of nature.

programme.title: Private Tour
programme.sub-title: Louvres Lens : Poland, painting the soul of a nation
programme.desc: For everyone who haven’t a chance to go to the museum, "Private Tour" propose you a private tour in 13 minutes to the best exposition of the moment with a professionnal or an expository commissioner. Private visit takes you to discover the exhibition "Poland 1840-1918, painting the soul of a nation" at the Louvre Museum in Lens. The aim of this exhibition is to show, through prestigious loans from Polish collections, how the painters of this period, at a time when Poland no longer exists, were able to put the national narrative into images and ensure that modern Poland was reborn.

programme.title: Art investigation
programme.desc: Art Investigation is a documentary series, each episode is devoted to a particular work. Discover the history of a statue of Napoleon built for the Vendôme column in Paris and which, after losing its head, became one of the centrepieces of the Musee de lArmee. This legendary work of 3.5m is signed by Charles Emile Seurre, a completely unknown sculptor.

programme.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
programme.sub-title: Tanni Grey Thompson and Jade Jones
programme.desc: Antiques experts accompany celebrities on a road trip around the UK searching for treasures and competing to make the most money at auction. Today we’re in the North East of England with top wheelchair paralympians Tanni Grey-Thompson and Jade Jones. Tanni has a record haul of medals and records, while her promising young protege Jade is just starting out on her athletics career. In the company of experts Phil Serrell and David Harper, the Baroness from County Durham and Middlesbrough’s Jade will be on the lookout for antiques to take to auction in Harrogate. Tanni also tries her hand at traditional glass making and Jade learns about the man who was a design champion of the region.

programme.title: The Chateaux of France, Living Splendors
programme.desc: This series takes us into the world of historical personalities and brings us face to face with those who keep the castles alive. As the former capital of the Renaissance France kingdom, Blois can boast of the first castle in the Loire Valley, a monument that became a prestige model for about thirty castles in the region. The curator is indeed proud to lead us behind the scenes, with the complicity of guardians, artists and experts. She also inspired the deployment of animations and spectacular shows that embody the Romanesque stories of the castle and enthral thousands of tourists.

programme.title: Artists Workshop
programme.desc: In the Artists workshop series, we offer you a privileged meeting with an artist, or the discovery of an artist or an important place for the history of art. Whether they are painters, visual artists, sculptors... These people all have the same passion for art and this show is an opportunity to enter their different universes, to discover what drives them, inspires them and maybe that will give rise to vocations.

programme.title: Origami
programme.desc: A square piece of paper and some patience, this is all you need to transform a flat surface into a superb tridimensional piece of art! Origami is about the art of paper folding, a Japanese and Chinese millenary tradition. In modern usage, the word “origami” is used as an inclusive term for all paper folding, regardless of their cultural origin. Different folding and sculpting techniques, new models, bright colors – you’ll see all of this in our program! We will teach you how to transform a flat square sheet of paper into a finished sculpture – from simple to complex!

programme.title: Sketchbook
programme.desc: An intimate instructional documentary series, Sketchbook takes us onto the desks and into the lives of talented artists and animators. Each episode focuses on a single artist teaching us how to draw a single iconic character from a Walt Disney Animation Studios film. As we learn the steps to drawing these characters, we also discover that the artists themselves each have a unique story to tell about how they made their way to Disney and their chosen character. From the creators of Chefs Table, this exclusive experience will give viewers of all ages a new understanding of how these beloved characters come to life on screen while introducing them to a new cast of real-life characters along way. Raphael Federici (street artist), Marine Goodmorning (illustrator), Luca Fiore (cartoonist) and Harry Boudchicha (drawing teacher) reveal their best drawing techniques. Each episode focuses on a specific subject:movement, oil painting, shadows, hair... For the first 10 minutes, each artist gives a theoretical lesson illustrated by sketches. Then they each start working on their creation. Finally, they end with a debrief, comparingand explaining their techniques.

programme.title: Private Tour
programme.desc: For everyone who haven’t a chance to go to the museum, "Private Tour" propose you a private tour in 13 minutes to the best exposition of the moment with a professionnal or an expository commissioner. Private Tour takes you to the discovery of the exhibition "Hans Hartung" at the Museum of Modern Art in Paris. This exhibition dedicated to this 20th century painter is a retrospective from 1904, the year of his birth, until his death in 1989, where we can observe all his production that was very important in the history of art.

programme.title: Exhibition on Screen
programme.sub-title: Rembrandt at the National Gallery, London and Rijksmuseum, Amsterdam
programme.desc: Up close with the world’s most celebrated artists and artworks in the highly acclaimed Exhibition on Screen film series. Every Rembrandt exhibition is eagerly awaited, but this exhibition organized by Londons National Gallery and Amsterdams Rijksmuseum was an unprecedented event. The documentary highlights the historic Rembrandt exhibition, while tracing his life. Rembrandt is one of the greatest artists who ever lived, and this deeply moving documentary seeks to explore the truth about the man behind the legend.

programme.title: The decisive moment
programme.desc: In each episode of the decisive moment, we welcome a photographer whom we have asked to select three photos that have marked their life and their career. Whether they are reporters, portraitists or fashion photographers, they all have the same passion and will share it with us. In this episode, we meet Cheryl Dunn, photographer. After moving to New York City in the mid-1980s, she spent much of her career photographing the citys streets and the people who made their mark on them. In the late 1990s, she began to focus on film, creating classic films about artists of her generation who influenced the realities of urban life through their own work.

programme.title: The decisive moment
programme.desc: In each episode of the decisive moment, we welcome a photographer whom we have asked to select three photos that have marked their life and their career. Whether they are reporters, portraitists or fashion photographers, they all have the same passion and will share it with us. In this episode, we will meet Zakaria Abdelkafi, photojournalist. He is Syrian, correspondent for the French news agency in Aleppo from 2013 to 2015, and he is now based in Paris because, after a report in Turkey, he was unable to return to his country. He will tell us his story and how he became a photographer.

programme.title: Graffiti World
programme.desc: Graffiti World is a short program dedicated to contemporary urban art around the world. Each episode explores a specific city, highlighting iconic works of street art. Graffiti World is a short program dedicated to contemporary urban art around the world. Each episode explores a specific city, highlighting iconic works of street art. Local soundscape accompanies the images for an authentic, commentary-free immersion. The program showcases the creativity and diversity of artistic expression in public spaces. An invitation to discover the richness of graffiti as an art form in its own right.

programme.title: Within the frame
programme.desc: Discover or re-discover the masterpieces of the greatest painters of history through our documentary series Within The Frame. From impressionists to surrealists, from Leonard Da Vinci to Paul Cezanne, every episode will immerge you into a virtual tour of a paintings collection. You will see the most impressive paintings ever made and wont miss a single detail. Situated in the heart of Paris, the Louvre Museum is home to some of the most stunning art collections in the world stretching from Antiquity to the present day. With more than 8 million visitors each year, it is the most visited museum in the world. From its collections, we propose to let you discover the works that cannot be ignored including the “Mona Lisa” by Leonardo da Vinci, “The Wedding at Cana” by Veronese, “Liberty Leading the People” by Delacroix and “La Grand Odalisque” by Ingres...Enjoy your visit!

programme.title: Masterpiece
programme.desc: A team of experts reveal the untold mysteries and surprising techniques behind some of the world’s most famous paintings in order to recreate them. Can the reconstruction ever live up the original? Can only a master create a masterpiece? Rembrandt van Rijn made the painting "Jeremiah" at the age of 24. It’s an incredibly complex painting in which all his talent comes together: The enchanting effect between sketchy finish and the small detail. But also the expression of all the different materials such as velvet, metal, red coral and rock. Team member Michel van de Laar has restored Rembrandt’s work in the past and discovered that there is something special hidden in the paint: A hair by Rembrandt. Also in the reconstruction, a hair will be put back. And not just any hair: an exciting search leads to a descendant of Rembrandt.

programme.title: Private Tour
programme.desc: For everyone who haven’t a chance to go to the museum, "Private Tour" propose you a private tour in 13 minutes to the best exposition of the moment with a professionnal or an expository commissioner. Private tour takes you on a tour of the "Picasso Masterpieces" exhibition at the National Picasso Museum in Paris. This exhibition tells the story of how Picassos works became important collectors items for everyone. Picasso himself questioned the notion of "masterpieces". He concluded that there is not only one way to make a work a true masterpiece. During this private tour you will be able to discover or rediscover some of his works such as "The young ladies of Avignon" or "Women at their toilet".

programme.title: Masterpiece
programme.desc: A team of experts reveal the untold mysteries and surprising techniques behind some of the world’s most famous paintings in order to recreate them. Can the reconstruction ever live up the original? Can only a master create a masterpiece? ‘Girl in a White Kimono’ is a painting from Breitners famous Kimono Girl series. As a preliminary study for his paintings, he used photographs of his model (Geesje Kwak) in kimono. To get as close as possible to the creative process of Breitner, the team will take a photo with Breitners original camera. The camera is fantastic museum piece in the safekeeping of Leiden University. It turns out to be a complicated chemical process with glass negatives and slow shutter speeds. Charlotte finds out that she needs a certain medium to be able to complete the reconstruction properly. Michel investigates and ends up in Cambridge; looking for a recipe in the archives of an old paint shop.

programme.title: Artists Workshop
programme.desc: In the Artists workshop series, we offer you a privileged meeting with an artist, or the discovery of an artist or an important place for the history of art. Whether they are painters, visual artists, sculptors... These people all have the same passion for art and this show is an opportunity to enter their different universes, to discover what drives them, inspires them and maybe that will give rise to vocations.

programme.title: The Chateaux of France, Living Splendors
programme.desc: This series takes us into the world of historical personalities and brings us face to face with those who keep the castles alive. This series takes us into the world of historical personalities such as François I, Leonardo Da Vinci and Catherine de Medici, but also takes us to meet those who continue to keep the castles alive. Historians, curators, caretakers, landscapers, artists and researchers have made these medieval jewels their daily life and their passion. They guide us behind the scenes of these magical places to discover paintings and multicoloured mosaics.

programme.title: Little Sketches
programme.desc: In 64 fun episodes, Gia-Haï Phan teaches you all the sketching techniques you need.

programme.title: Architectures
programme.desc: Initiated by Richard Copans and Stan Neumann in 1994, the Architectures collection is comprised of 67 episodes, each focusing on a single building from classical, modern, or contemporary architecture. These "architecture masterclasses" are a magnificent mixture of rigor, pleasure and intelligence. In the aftermath of the First World War, the parish priest of Raincy decided to build a new church. But the country was ruined and the clergys coffers were empty. One man rose to the double challenge of urgency and budget: architect Auguste Perret. At the time, building quickly and cheaply meant using reinforced concrete. An unloved and shameful material, reserved for industrial works. It took only 13 months to build this "Sainte chapelle du beton

programme.title: Art investigation
programme.desc: Art Investigation is a documentary series, each episode is devoted to a particular work. We investigate on an exceptional vase produced at the Sèvres Manufactory in 1810. In the form of an Etruscan scroll, it celebrates the entry into Paris of works destined for the Napoleon Museum. What is this little-known historical event, which took place in 1798? And what is the hidden meaning of the painting and the decorations that adorn it? This documentary traces the history of the production of this extraordinary piece, its inspiration drawn from antiquity, but also investigates the event it recounts: Napoleons spoliation of Italian collections, at a time when criticism was already being voiced about the movement of works of art in times of war. When the Empire fell, the director of the Manufacture had to use subterfuge to save the vase from destruction.

programme.title: Art Quiz
programme.desc: Test your knowledge and your memory in fine arts, architecture, photography, street art and a dozen other topics with our Art Quiz popups !

programme.title: Sketchbook
programme.desc: An intimate instructional documentary series, Sketchbook takes us onto the desks and into the lives of talented artists and animators. programme.title: Exhibition on Screen
programme.desc: Up close with the world’s most celebrated artists and artworks in the highly acclaimed Exhibition on Screen film series. Narrated by Gillian Anderson, this episode of Exhibition on Screen follows the footsteps of French artists such as Renoir and Monet, the American Impressionist movement forged its own path. Painted over a period of 40 years, these paintings reveal the United States both as a nation and as a creative breeding ground. The history of this movement is closely linked to the love of gardens and the desire to preserve nature in a country undergoing rapid urbanization. This enchanting journey through workshops, gardens and famous sites in the USA, UK and France is a feast for the eyes.

programme.title: Graffiti World
programme.desc: Graffiti World is a short program dedicated to contemporary urban art around the world. Each episode explores a specific city, highlighting iconic works of street art. Graffiti World is a short program dedicated to contemporary urban art around the world. Each episode explores a specific city, highlighting iconic works of street art. Local soundscape accompanies the images for an authentic, commentary-free immersion. The program showcases the creativity and diversity of artistic expression in public spaces. An invitation to discover the richness of graffiti as an art form in its own right.

programme.title: A special day
programme.desc: Museum takes you behind the scenes of prestigious institutions and lets you experience a special day by immersing yourself in the daily life of an art world professional. In this episode, we will spend a special day with Fanny Bouyagui, visual artist and director of the association Art Point M, and who is at the origin of the Braderie de lArt in Roubaix. Since 1991, this event welcomes dozens of artists with a single motto, create from recycled objects. But before the arrival of the public, Fanny must make sure that certain rules are respected. We will accompany her throughout this very busy day.

programme.title: My little Museum
programme.desc: My little Museum is Art History retold through funny anecdotes and backstage trivias by Alicia Flipo. With her wacky demeanor, her inventiveness and her quirky sense of humor, Alicia stages these small Art tales so that once and for all, you could remember the Big stories!

programme.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
programme.sub-title: Lynne Faulds Wood and John Stapleton
programme.desc: Antiques experts accompany celebrities on a road trip around the UK searching for treasures and competing to make the most money at auction. A celebrity couple Road Trip – award winning journalists John Stapleton and Lynn Faulds Wood. Joining them on this jolly jaunt are Thomas Plant and Margie Cooper. With £400 in their pockets the teams kick off in Wrightington, Lancashire and head to Stockport for auction. Lynn and Thomas find themselves literally knee deep in antiques while hunting for old biscuit tins while Margie tries to convince John some rare lamps will make a profit. Also John learns how an American revolutionised British public transport and Lynn sees why snakes are milked in Liverpool.

programme.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
programme.sub-title: Tanni Grey Thompson and Jade Jones
programme.desc: Antiques experts accompany celebrities on a road trip around the UK searching for treasures and competing to make the most money at auction. Today we’re in the North East of England with top wheelchair paralympians Tanni Grey-Thompson and Jade Jones. Tanni has a record haul of medals and records, while her promising young protege Jade is just starting out on her athletics career. In the company of experts Phil Serrell and David Harper, the Baroness from County Durham and Middlesbrough’s Jade will be on the lookout for antiques to take to auction in Harrogate. Tanni also tries her hand at traditional glass making and Jade learns about the man who was a design champion of the region.

programme.title: The Chateaux of France, Living Splendors
programme.desc: This series takes us into the world of historical personalities and brings us face to face with those who keep the castles alive. With its stern and elegant architecture, the castle of Saumur stands with prestige above the city. The building, reminiscent of chivalry tales, offers an endless source of pride for the inhabitants. This historical jewel is indeed overlooking a millennium of war and peace and enables the convergence of two worlds of passion. The other vibrant activity is the regional wine production and the gastronomic specialties that gravitate around. The local economy and the castle draw upon these talents and the two communities are honoured during medieval parties and cavalry shows.

programme.title: Art investigation
programme.desc: Art Investigation is a documentary series, each episode is devoted to a particular work. Sculptures of severed heads are on display at the Granet Museum in Aix en Provence, among many other relics dating back to 300 BC. We will visit the archaeological site of the oppidum of Entremont. The capital of the Salyans. With the archaeologist Patrice Arcelin, we will get to know these Gauls better, to better understand their rites. Rituals common to many peoples throughout the world, as we will see with Yves Le Fur, the director of the collections of the Musee du quai Branly. This survey of art will take us back to a time when Gauls and Romans were fighting for territory but also sharing their cultures.

programme.title: Within the frame
programme.desc: Discover or re-discover the masterpieces of the greatest painters of history through our documentary series Within The Frame. From impressionists to surrealists, from Leonard Da Vinci to Paul Cezanne, every episode will immerge you into a virtual tour of a paintings collection. You will see the most impressive paintings ever made and wont miss a single detail. A Florentine painter, Sandro Botticelli is considered as one of the most famous 15th century Italian painters. Close to the Medici family, he is renowned and admired for his portraits and his female nudes inspired by Greek mythology, such as the majestic “Birth of Venus”, exhibited in the Uffizi Gallery in Florence, and also presented to you here.Enjoy your visit!

programme.title: Private Tour
programme.sub-title: James Ensor - Ostende and Anvers - September 2024
programme.desc: For everyone who haven’t a chance to go to the museum, "Private Tour" propose you a private tour in 13 minutes to the best exposition of the moment with a professionnal or an expository commissioner. The cities of Ostend and Antwerp celebrate the 75th anniversary of James Ensors death. The famous avant-garde artist, known for his revolutionary vision of art and his influence on modern painting, is more alive than ever through four exhibitions: at the Royal Museum of Fine Arts Antwerp, the Plantin-Moretus Museum, the Fashion Museum and the Photo Museum. “Private Visit” invites you to explore the dreamlike, colorful world of James Ensor alongside the curators of these museums.

programme.title: Exhibition on Screen
programme.sub-title: The Impressionists - and the Man Who Made Them
programme.desc: Up close with the world’s most celebrated artists and artworks in the highly acclaimed Exhibition on Screen film series. They are the world’s most popular artists. The works of Cezanne, Monet, Degas and their compatriots fetch tens of millions of dollars. But just who were they really? Why and how did they paint? What lies behind their enduring appeal? To help answer these questions, this programme secured unique access to a major exhibition focussing on the 19th century Parisian art collector Paul Durand-Ruel, the outspoken champion of Impressionism. This eagerly anticipated exhibition is perhaps the most comprehensive ever held about the Impressionists.

programme.title: Photo Contest
programme.desc: In each episode of Photo Contest, two contestants compete on an imposed theme such as rockn roll, Japan or architecture. They have one hour to take the best possible photographs before editing them for 30 minutes in a studio. The photographs they have selected are then presented to Agnès Gregoire, editor-in-chief of PHOTO magazine, who will have to choose the best photographer.

programme.title: Yoga for kids
programme.desc: Learn to relax, focus, and exercise your body and mind. This TV show will help parents and teachers who want to share the benefits of yoga with young children. With beautiful step-by-step illustrations and audio that appeals to the senses, each exercise features a familiar animal or natural element that kids will enjoy identifying with. Today Im going to teach you how to do an exercise the night before to feel focused like a little bee in the air.

With beautiful step-by-step illustrations and audio that appeals to the senses, each exercise features a familiar animal or natural element that kids will enjoy identifying with. programme.title: Yoga for kids
programme.desc: Learn to relax, focus, and exercise your body and mind. This TV show will help parents and teachers who want to share the benefits of yoga with young children. With beautiful step-by-step illustrations and audio that appeals to the senses, each exercise features a familiar animal or natural element that kids will enjoy identifying with. Today Im going to teach you how to do the tree in the wind. A simple exercise to calm down when you are agitated or excited.

programme.title: Earth from Above
programme.desc: Earth from Above is a documentary series presented by the photographer Yann Arthus-Bertrand and inspired by his best-selling book, aimed at confronting and examining the main issues facing the planet. The story of our planet, so alive and so fragile, is told by men and women from all over the world, all committed and passionate. A portrait of our planet that is both magical and realistic, moving and ingenious. To better understand the role of these explosive mountains located all over the world, on land or under the sea, Yann Arthus-Bertrand goes to Italy, the country with the most active volcanoes in Europe. Accompanied by volcano expert Jacques-Marie Bardintzeff, the photographer meets those people who have chosen to live with « their » volcano, in spite of the dangers involved in this kind of proximity.

programme.title: Julies Frenchy Cookbook
programme.desc: Julies Frenchy Cookbook. Today, Julie takes us on a mushroom tour. There is nothing better to occupy your weekends than a walk in the forest in search of edible mushrooms. Some species, such as the cep or the chanterelle, can be preserved very well in the freezer or, for the more patient, in jars. We will also meet two chefs who are passionate about mushrooms and have become specialists in the subject: Franck Quinton and Regis Marcon. But for the moment, were on the road, discovering typically French dishes with astonishing button mushrooms in Touraine, morels in the Jura, ceps in Gironde, russules charbonnières in Normandy and coulemelles in Auvergne!

programme.title: Origami
programme.desc: A square piece of paper and some patience, this is all you need to transform a flat surface into a superb tridimensional piece of art! Origami is about the art of paper folding, a Japanese and Chinese millenary tradition. In modern usage, the word “origami” is used as an inclusive term for all paper folding, regardless of their cultural origin. Different folding and sculpting techniques, new models, bright colors – you’ll see all of this in our program! We will teach you how to transform a flat square sheet of paper into a finished sculpture – from simple to complex!

programme.title: Julies Frenchy Cookbook
programme.desc: Julies Frenchy Cookbook. This week, it is 80 kms from the capital, in Fontainebleau, that Julie is putting down her bags. Fontainebleau, a name famous throughout the world, a magical name which evokes for some a forest, for others a castle, a name which still shines with its royal history. The forest of Fontainebleau has inspired the art world since the beginning of the 19th century. Landscape painters such as Corot and Millet drew inspiration for their works there. But Fontainebleau has many other treasures in its bag, and gastronomy is part of its heritage. This is what Julie will discover through three recipes: Quail with grapes, raspberry and poppy pie and crayfish grave.

A study of complimentary opposites, this practice will challenge you to find the balance within the opposition.

programme.title: Home training
programme.desc: Enjoy our tutorials and coaching, exercises, and practical lifestyle tips to help you live better. This episode of Home Training is dedicated to a thighs-abs-glutes session, considered the key to a strong foundation. Guillaume and Sabrina start with a full warm-up, emphasizing the importance of preparing the body before exercise. The session is divided into two blocks: the first targeting thighs and glutes, while the second focuses on abs with intensity variations. Viewers are encouraged to complete both blocks for a balanced workout. With expert guidance and modifications, everyone can adapt the session to their level while taking on the challenge!

programme.title: Yoga
